description: '''Jangle pop''' is a [[Music subgenre|subgenre]] of [[pop rock]] and [[indie rock]] that emphasizes [[jangle|jangly]] guitars and 1960s-style [[pop music|pop]] melodies. The "jangly" guitar sound is characterized by its clean, shimmering and [[Arpeggio|arpeggiated]] tone, often created using [[12-string electric guitar]]s. The term is usually applied to late 1970s/early 1980s bands emerging from the [[post-punk]] scene, often influenced by 1960s groups such as the [[Byrds]]. Notable acts include [[Big Star]], [[R.E.M.]] and [[the Smiths]].
